com.linkedin.parseq

Class EngineBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linkedin.parseq.EngineBuilder

  • public class EngineBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    A configurable builder that makes Engines.

    Minimum required configuration:

    • taskExecutor
    • timerScheduler
    Author:
    Chris Pettitt (cpettitt@linkedin.com)

      EngineBuilder()

    • Method Detail

      • setTaskExecutor

        public EngineBuilder setTaskExecutor(java.util.concurrent.Executor taskExecutor)
        Sets the task executor for the engine.

        The lifecycle of the executor is not managed by the engine.

        Parameters:
        taskExecutor - the executor to use for the engine
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setTimerScheduler

        public EngineBuilder setTimerScheduler(DelayedExecutor timerScheduler)
        Sets the timer scheduler for the engine.

        The lifecycle of the scheduler is not managed by the engine.

        Parameters:
        timerScheduler - the scheduler to use for the engine
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setTimerScheduler

        public EngineBuilder setTimerScheduler(java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService timerScheduler)
        Sets the timer scheduler for the engine.

        The lifecycle of the scheduler is not managed by the engine.

        Parameters:
        timerScheduler - the scheduler to use for the engine
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setLoggerFactory

        public EngineBuilder setLoggerFactory(org.slf4j.ILoggerFactory loggerFactory)
        Sets the logger factory that will be used by the engine. By default the engine will use whatever log binding SLF4J has detected.
        Parameters:
        loggerFactory - the logger factory to used by the engine.
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setEngineProperty

        public EngineBuilder setEngineProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                       java.lang.Object value)
        Sets an engine related property on the engine. That property can then be accessed by tasks via the Context.
        Parameters:
        key -
        value -
        Returns:
        this builder

      • build

        public Engine build()
        Checks that the require configuration has been set and then constructs and returns a new Engine.
        Returns:
        a new Engine using the configuration in this builder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the configuration in this builder is invalid.
